stream_context.summary: Kaze iterates on the seamless overworld for Return to Yoshi’s Island, focusing on how the player will reach the Wing-Cap (rooftop) stage, how coins and shops will work, and how late-game Bowser/Yoshi boss arenas fit spatially. He adds placeholders, sketches new connections, debates design trade-offs, and tests performance on real N64 hardware.

development_findings.summary: Cloud-Cap will be removed from the overworld because free flight lets players break scenery; Kaze seeks an alternate Wing-Cap entrance (balloon, shop purchase, baby-mobile warp, or event).
development_findings.quote: Having the Cloud Cap in the overworld is going to be awkward … you could just go to a previous part and break the world geometry and look over the walls.

development_findings.summary: The overworld is one continuous map with no warp loads; events will dynamically alter it (e.g., pirate attack creates sunken ship).
development_findings.quote: The entire overworld is going to be one huge map that's going to be seamless.

development_findings.summary: Events give stars and permanently change terrain; Kaze counts nine slots still open for such events.
development_findings.quote: We can put nine events. So if we have an event that would work with this, then that's also good.

development_findings.summary: Coins need value: first confirmed shop is a Bob-omb cannon operator who charges 200 coins; more shops will be added to justify collecting currency.
development_findings.quote: We definitely need to add shops. Otherwise you’re gonna go your whole life collecting coins not knowing what they're for.

development_findings.summary: Kaze adds a visible but unreachable star in the overworld to tease future unlocks.
development_findings.quote: The star is just there the whole time, and you have no idea how to get there. This is great.

development_findings.summary: Boss arena planning: Yoshi-Bowser fight occurs after part 6; arena will be surrounded by thorn bushes and wilted crops to stop escape.
development_findings.quote: This part is an apple tree garden at first; during the fight all the trees are wilted and Bowser destroys them.

development_findings.summary: Performance test: game runs 60 FPS on real N64; widescreen mode costs ~10 % performance, still acceptable.
development_findings.quote: Look, 60 FPS… With widescreen it’s still 52ish. Isn’t that cool?

development_findings.summary: All 15 main courses are designed; remaining workload is overworld layout, side levels, Yoshi-star tasks, and polish.
development_findings.quote: All 15 main courses are done … The overworld is pretty much the last part.

development_findings.summary: Custom collision system replaces SM64’s; Biobak reworks visuals first, then Kaze rebuilds collision.
development_findings.quote: I have a completely different collision system from R64. The normal one is not good.

development_findings.summary: ROM size is ~60 MB; coded in C; fewer custom power-ups than Lost Impact but still several unique mechanics.
development_findings.quote: The game is around 60 MB right now.

context_findings.summary: Video editing costs are financed by sponsorships; Kaze hopes next Saturday’s video recoups expense.
context_findings.quote: At this point I have to finance my video editing with sponsor deals… it was very expensive to pay for the editing.

context_findings.summary: Kaze worries about Nintendo legal action and considers contingency re-branding.
context_findings.quote: Nintendo might just murder me … maybe I should do that before I release it so if they kill me I can say I thought about this.

context_findings.summary: Personal frugality: refuses barber, wife Zeina cuts his hair; chat comments on new look.
context_findings.quote: My wife did it. I am too cheap to go to a barber.

context_findings.summary: Enjoys watching beta testers improvise strategies in Drunk Mario 64; community feedback informs tweaks.
context_findings.quote: It’s been a joy seeing the testers interact with this game and seeing what they do.

biobak.summary: Reworks visual passes for multiple levels including Wing-Cap stage, Koopa Wave Cove, Lofty Lumber Leaps, and teaches Kaze workflow shortcuts.
biobak.quote: Biobak definitely did this part here … Using the trick Biobak taught me.

badub.summary: Composes overworld music and experiments with mixing and reverb options.
badub.quote: Badub’s working with music a little bit, trying to figure out what would work for the overworld.

zeina.summary: Provides concept art for the gondola to Course 10 entrance and handles Kaze’s haircut; also fixes DSIs off-stream.
zeina.quote: I think Zeina had a concept art for this component … my wife fixes DSIs.

key_stories.title: Scrapping the Cloud-Cap
key_stories.summary: Originally players would collect a Cloud-Cap in the overworld to reach the rooftop Wing-Cap stage. Kaze realized free flight would let players peek behind scenery and ruin immersion, so he cut the mechanic mid-stream.
key_stories.challenge: Cloud-Cap broke visual boundaries and demanded expensive geometry fixes.
key_stories.process: Brainstormed alternatives live: shop purchase, balloon event, baby-mobile warp, stormy Lakitus, etc.
key_stories.outcome: Decided Cloud-Cap is out; entrance will be redesigned via event or shop (TBD).
key_stories.key_quote: Having the Cloud Cap in the overworld is going to be awkward … we can’t have that.

key_stories.title: Giving Coins Real Value
key_stories.summary: Testers hoarded coins without purpose. Kaze introduced shops, starting with a Bob-omb cannon that costs 200 coins to fire, making currency meaningful.
key_stories.challenge: Coin collection felt pointless in earlier builds.
key_stories.process: Identified need, placed cannon NPC, set price point, planned additional purchasables.
key_stories.outcome: Coin economy added to design pillars; further items will be added in other overworld zones.
key_stories.key_quote: We definitely need to add shops, otherwise you're gonna go your whole life collecting coins not knowing what they're for.

key_stories.title: Designing the Yoshi-Bowser Arena
key_stories.summary: Post-second Bowser, the island wilts; Kaze sketches an apple (now melon) orchard that withers, thorn bushes rise, creating an inescapable boss arena.
key_stories.challenge: Need large, flat space that doesn’t telegraph ‘boss fight’ early.
key_stories.process: Debated flatness, added crops for early acts, planned dynamic wilt and thorns during fight.
key_stories.outcome: Arena layout locked; visual cues will change dynamically at fight start.
key_stories.key_quote: This area here is a flat fuck land … during the fight all the trees are wilted and Bowser destroys them.

open_questions.context: Kaze worries five overworld areas unlock simultaneously after Bowser 2; considering blocking part 13.
